image.altText: A car on fire with flashing lights seen through the mist of smoke, and numbered evidence markers on the road

items.synopsis: Police knew when Alen Moradian was shot dead a month ago that Sydney's gangland could explode. After a week of violence, they say it is all about control of drug trade in the city.

title.children: 'We know for a fact what's behind it all': The common thread linking Sydney's gangland shootings

image.altText: a woman looks at the destruction caused after a bushfire burnt down her home

items.synopsis: Recent wildfires across the Mediterranean coupled with warnings of El Niño and Earth's hottest month on record have raised questions about what's ahead for Australia's bushfire season.

title.children: Why a repeat of Black Summer is unlikely this fire season despite El Niño warnings

image.altText: A teenage boy with short hair wearing a grey hoodie gazes into the camera.

items.synopsis: Gymnast Josh was training for 14 hours a week until two bad falls set him off course. After the teen suffered debilitating brain fog, dizziness and trouble focusing, his mother says getting the right concussion diagnosis and treatment was a "gruelling" process.

title.children: Josh didn't black out when he hit his head. Weeks later, he got worried

image.altText: A crowd of people stand outside 10 Downing Street, at the centre is a woman in black dress holding her phone

items.synopsis: Dressed in an ermine-trimmed red robe, Charlotte Owen was sworn in as the newest baroness in the House of Lords. But her appointment has sparked a debate about the state of British democracy.

title.children: Charlotte Owen is the youngest peer in the House of Lords. But the newly minted baroness is outraging Britain

image.altText: Albanese stands speaking to media from a courtyard.

items.synopsis: Anthony Albanese has signalled a return to a sharper political contest with his announcement that the government would be reintroducing the legislation for its Housing Australia Future Fund next week, writes Laura Tingle.

title.children: With a possible double dissolution, Albanese has an exceptionally rare opportunity

image.altText: Damage to the wing of a plane after a collision

items.synopsis: Queensland Police Acting Superintendent Paul Ready said it incident was a "devastating loss of life".

title.children: Couple in their 60s who died after two planes collided north of Brisbane identified as David and Jan Maddern

image.altText: An aerial view of streets in suburban Melbourne, on a sunny day.

items.synopsis: Some suburbs are now seeing as much as a 14.4 per cent growth in median house value.

title.children: Some Australian suburbs are experiencing another property market boom. Is yours one of them?

image.altText: Steve Smith holds his bat as he walks towards the middle

items.synopsis: A long Ashes series is approaching its conclusion, but on a day where the Australians could have seen the fifth Test slip away entirely, they proved there is still fight in their weary legs.

title.children: A weary Australia is limping towards the Ashes finish line, but a spirited fightback has kept it alive

image.altText: Anthony Albanese and Max Chandler-Mather voting on election day.

items.synopsis: The threat of an early election has done little to convince the federal Greens to abandon their opposition to the federal government's $10 billion housing future fund.

title.children: Greens shrug off threat of early election, sending PM letter with housing demands

image.altText: Trump in front of a US flag, raising his fist

items.synopsis: Donald Trump has been charged after trying and failing to delete CCTV evidence of farcical and allegedly criminal behaviour. How was he brought undone by a bunch of boxes?

title.children: Trump took boxes of classified documents home and kept them next to his toilet. Here's why it could land him in jail

image.altText: Kylie Minogue, wearing a black strappy dress and chunky diamond necklace, smiles on the red carpet

items.synopsis: Australia's princess of pop will star in her first residency, following a run of successes with her recent hit Padam Padam.

title.children: 'Vegas baby!' Kylie Minogue announces first residency

image.altText: A background image of a mine site, with pictures of four mining figures from left to right.

items.synopsis: The business partnership between Lang Hancock and Peter Wright created billions – but the fractured relationship between the men's heirs is now playing out in the WA Supreme Court.

title.children: Dollars, dynasties and division: How the first week of Gina Rinehart's mining royalties civil trial unfolded

image.altText: A woman with short red hair sits behind a desk, with books on it, in front of peacock-prinyed wallpaper.

items.synopsis: The murder of the influential wallpaper designer in her Sydney factory in 1977 remains unsolved. Now her granddaughter wants answers.

title.children: Almost half a century after designer Florence Broadhurst's gruesome murder, her granddaughter breaks her silence

image.altText: A man in a hair salon chair holds up dreadlocks that have been cut off.

items.synopsis: Christopher Mark Jordan, 36, appears in a Launceston court accused of murdering a Tasmanian teen after the discovery of human remains in bushland this week.

title.children: Man accused of murdering teen Shyanne-Lee Tatnell named in first court appearance

image.altText: You view a 20-something Eurasian son pictured with his Filipina mother against a cream wall.

items.synopsis: Migrations don't just happen, they're produced. It's a thread Alan Weedon followed as he retraced his mum Jesusita's story after her death.

title.children: Not just another 'Filipina bride': In grief, Alan searched for his mother's story

image.altText: A smiling man in a suit and tie

items.synopsis: Lawyers for war veteran Heston Russell accuse the ABC of engaging in an "inexcusable abuse of power" by publishing "false articles" before using a "PR machine" to defend the journalism.

title.children: ABC accused of engaging in 'inexcusable abuse of power' by publishing 'false articles' about war veteran

image.altText: Two female football players, wearin white with blue shorts, running and celebrating.

items.synopsis: The Lionesses are on the cusp of qualifying for the Round of 16 with a victory in Sydney, but another injury blow has soured their win.

title.children: England beat Denmark 1-0 but win soured by injury to star Walsh, China overcomes Haiti

image.altText: STeve Smith dives

items.synopsis: Joe Root takes a mind-bending catch, while Steve Smith survives the tightest of run-out decisions as Australia battles hard on day two of the fifth Ashes Test at The Oval. Here are five things you missed overnight.

title.children: Five quick hits — Steve Smith's great run-out escape and Joe Root's stunning catch

image.altText: An archaeological dig site with ruins visible and deep holes and people standing around

items.synopsis: Previously only referred to in ancient Roman texts, the long-lost theatre of emperor Nero is found under a garden in Rome.

title.children: Ancient Roman ruins of Nero's Theatre discovered under hotel garden

image.altText: A close up image of a baby breastfeeding.

items.synopsis: It's natural to worry about the safety of children, but it seems there are real dangers, confected dangers and also concerns about dangers that only seem to exist for one small group of kids who all have mums that have travelled a similar path, writes Virginia Trioli.

title.children: When a mum breastfeeding her baby sparks outrage, we're focusing on the wrong things

image.altText: A faint blue flame is burning from a gas element on a stainless steel cooktop

items.synopsis: The Victorian government will ban gas connections to new homes and residential subdivisions from January 1 next year.

title.children: Victoria bans gas connections in new homes from 2024

image.altText: Australia batter Todd Murphy hits the ball with his bat during an Ashes Test.

items.synopsis: Australia takes the entirety of day two of the final Ashes Test at the Oval to do what England did in about 50 overs and finally passes the hosts' first-innings total shortly before stumps.

title.children: Australia's tail wags after Steve Smith's departure to get slim first-innings lead at The Oval

image.altText: A close up image of a woman with an unidentified child

items.synopsis: The suspected murder of Perth mother Georgia Lyall, believed by police to be at the hands of her ex-partner, leaves those who knew her grieving and in disbelief.

title.children: 'You deserved so much more than this': Tributes flow for victim of suspected murder-suicide

image.altText: Man in high-vis holds hose and nozzle as he refuels a truck

items.synopsis: The nation's largest supplier of industrial gas, Coregas, opens a first-of-its-kind commercial hydrogen refuelling station for heavy vehicles in the Illawarra.

title.children: Australia's first commercial hydrogen refuelling station for trucks opens at Port Kembla

image.altText: Meaghan Louise Rose, who died in a fall at Point Cartwright in 1997, holding a scroll in an undated photo

items.synopsis: Police have obtained an arrest warrant for 70-year-old Keith Lees in relation to the alleged murder of a 25-year-old Sunshine Coast woman in 1997.

title.children: Queensland police issue arrest warrant over cold case alleged murder of Meaghan Rose

image.altText: Cows in flood water, aerial view.

items.synopsis: Additional federal funding is announced for 20 projects designed to mitigate the impact of floods in northern NSW, with almost half the money to go towards raising access roads to the low-lying town of Ballina.

title.children: Securing evacuation routes key focus of new $100m flood-resilience package for NSW Northern Rivers

image.altText: Members of the Ukrainian Navy fire a gun during naval drills on a ship.

items.synopsis: With no naval fleet, Kyiv has been relying on sea drone technology and land-launched missiles to push back Moscow's maritime power. As Black Sea tensions simmer, will this continue to be enough?

title.children: Ukraine 'doesn't have a navy', while Russia has 'the lot'. Can innovation beat big ships in the Black Sea battle?

image.altText: A woman looks happy after leaving the pool.

items.synopsis: Australian swimming star Mollie O'Callaghan backs up her 200m freestyle title by claiming the 100m at the world championships in Japan.

title.children: O'Callaghan creates world championship swimming history after sweeping the 100m and 200m freestyle titles

image.altText: A row of heavily armed men in camo gear, carrying guns

items.synopsis: Yevgeny Prigozhin's attempted mutiny last month might have failed in Russia, but in Mali and a handful of other African nations, the Wagner Group's influence — and reign of terror — is expanding.

title.children: Over five horrific days, armed Russian mercenaries tortured an African town. Is this Wagner's future?

image.altText: a woman smiles into the distance next to a cane field

items.synopsis: For a long time, the eldest son has been seen as the natural successor to a family farm. But there is change on the horizon.

title.children: 'It’s opened Dad’s eyes': Grace grew up thinking her brother would get the farm. Things have changed in her life time
